column5: Our reservation fell through this year. Looking for fairly remote Southern Quebec outfitter (no popular resorts). We don't mind navigating a logging road. Willing to consider almost anything at this point. I'm sure there are lots of places we've never heard of. Anyone have suggestions? Thanks.
You could try using this trip planner:http://www.pourvoiries.com/en/planne...1#.URf95vLC6Pwhttp://www.pourvoiries.com/en/interactive-map.html

Try the Kipawa area. Good lodges on Kipawa, and down the logging roads you got a few mainly Ogascanan, Sasseginaga outpost and Bush Country Camp. Visit Kipawa.net for a bunch of others on the lake kipawa
4 hours back Clova rd. Eyes, lake trout & pike. Comfortable lodging, nice boats, new motors.
Air Tamarac will not disappoint you. Here is a video I put together of our trip there this past summer. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WiPCqmilG3I
Thanks for the suggestions. Still looking but many more options than I thought.
